text: Another concentrated berry juice bomb here. The grape from the port adds a thick velvet like complexity to the berries, the background is a strong honey flavored sweetness.

This one has that same odd aroma as the last one, almost balsamic. Very odd. Thankfully tastes so much better. Ripe raspberry, very tart, very full flavored and delicious. The finish lingers on the tongue, very acidic, even a bit tongue puckering tannin too. Very yummy mead, but the aroma and finish arent for me.

Bottle shared by a friend, poured a deep dark red colour. Sweet honey, sweet sticky raspberry, thick raspberry by, earth barrel notes, oak, soft vineous porto notes, sweet red grapes, vanilla, abd leather. Deep sticky raspberry honey, clear earthy port notes. Thick and full bodied. Deicious

Dangerous Bottleshares XL forealz edition. Pours a deep deep dark red with no head. Aroma of raspberries, raspberries and raspberries in different shapes and conditions. Also some syrup, honey, vanilla, slight strawberries and decadentness. The taste is sweet and sticky with notes of.... raspberries, sweet port, syrup, honey, cherry wine, slight tart raspberries and vanilla. A very very hard mead to hate.

Bottle thanks to Jeff and Jen from superstition at Dangerous Bottleshares XL 4Realz Edition Motherbrother, Hoprider and Aaron. Pours a very dark reddish purple clear. Aroma has PACKED with raspberry, port wine, pretty tart, vinous, slight hints of heather honey spicy and floral notes. Taste is pretty tart, slight pithy raspberry bitterness and a heavy, oily sweetness leading to a nice, organic, floral honey finish. Super oily texture. Very tasty!

Bottle thanks to the Jeff and Jenn from Superstition. Thank you so much guys. Pours deep beautiful dark red. Aromas of tart raspberries, port, subtle tannins, sweet honey, subtle floral. Taste is jammy as hell, tart, subtle vinous dryness, tannins, honey. Damn.

Dark dark ruby bluish red.. the aroma has intense raspberry, very vinous and almost berry spices thats how aromatic this is. The taste is wildly fruity and has a good sour kick to balance the sweetness. I really love this stuff. Sweet, dry and so much fruit its unbelievable. Long aftertaste.
Bottle @ Dangerous Bottleshares XL feat. Motherbrother, hoprider and FranzBC. Deep purple pour. Notes of raspberries, tannins, oak, sweet caramel, honey, vanilla, port and some light oxidation.

October 15, 2016. Bottle. 
Dark ruby red with no head. Aroma is intense fruity with raspberries, blackberries, hints of cherries, cactus, a touch of raisins, hints of vanilla.
Taste is very sweet, fruity and tart. 
Finish is dry, slight astringent, sour berries, some sweet notes of raisins, dark berries, dry slight astringent berry skin and oak notes. 
Medium to full bodied, oily texture, dry finish.

Bottle bought through Hackobock. Pours deep ruby red leaving some nice-looking legs on the glass with a swirl. Smell is heavy fruity with honey, raspberries, blackberries, bilberries, dark grapes, black currants, moist wood, vanilla, minerals, port wine and alcohol. Taste is slightly sweet, sour, heavy fruity and slightly woody. Mouthfeel is round, viscous, oily, tiny dry, tart, slightly boozy and near full bodied. Finish is tiny sweet and sour with extremely rich and complex berry and port characteristics. Amazingly complex sipper. As with its brother its very fun to see this level of complexity reached without insane sweetness levels. The price point is crazy steep but I guess thats fair with such a high end product.

Bottle at Linus tasting 161015. Clear amber/reddish color. Honey and raspberry aroma, nectar, raspberry jam, some vanilla. Sweet cherry and raspberry flavor, sugary, honey, red currant. Lots of berries. Quite overpriced.
A: Deep purple coloured N: Raspberry, billberry, blackberry, boysenberry T: Raspberry, boysenberries, rowanberries O: Very nice berries to it!
Absolute perfection. Raspberry juice bursting. Stuff tastes half as strong as it is and is the best mead I have ever had

Bottle at Superstition, pours a deep dark mahogany. Aroma brings out loads raspberries upfront, followed by medium honey nectar notes. Flavour is exquisite, with loads of prominent raspberries upfront, followed by medium honey sweetness. Sweet but nowhere close to cloying. Fantastic stuff.

Pours a deep purple red. Very bright and clear. Aromas of raspberry jam, light hints of wine tannins. Slight alcohol. Taste is sweet obviously but surprisingly finished with a slight tart kick to it compared to the framboesa. Mind blown by this stuff.
Taster pour at the meadery. Blood red pour. Massive raspberry nose. Sweet raspberry, a hint of honey and some oak, raspberry seed and tannin in the finish. Wonderful.

Bottle share at RBB. Pour is ruby red with no head. Flavor and aroma of vanilla beans, oak, port barrels, honey, various berries, and light cream. Finish is balanced nicely between the booze/port/oak and sweet fruit.
A wonderful barrel aged mead from Superstition. None of the syrupy mouthfeel present in so many meads. I though it would be hard to top the white series, but these do just that. Amazing!

Bottle @ RBWG 2016. Blood red in color. Holy smokes...this is good. Huge port, red grape, raspberry, and honey. A really nice sweetness to it, but some vinous qualities add just a touch of acidity and drying tannins. Hints of black pepper and some nice fruit skins. Full bodied, slightly woody, and a nice balance of acidity and sweetness.

Bottle shared by daknole at the RB Best Awards - thanks again, Dak! Pours a cloudy, deep ruby violet mahogany color with no head. Rich red grapes, plums, port, honey, black cherry, raspberry, and a bit of caramel. Full-bodied, with a coating, rich mouthfeel. Massive stuff.

Bottle thanks to dak at ratebeer best bottle share. pours out a deep mahogany no head. Nose is amazing raspberry jam vanilla sweetness. Taste is more of the raspberry cream. Very well balanced with the light tart berries and honey sweetness.

[1/30/16] Bottle sample at the Encomium bottle share, after RateBeer Best awards ceremony at Hyatt Vineyard Creek Hotel in Santa Rosa. Thanks everyone who shared bottles! Deep red-purple. Huge jammy raspberries. Sweet. Rounded. Really delicious.

Bottle at the Rate Beer Awards Festival Bottle Share, from Dak. Big nsoe of raspberry, honey, port. So sweet, huge, creamy flavors, luscious raspberries and port vinous character just melts in my mouth. Fabulous.

Bottle shared by daknole at the RB awards 
Clear dark mahogany, no head or lacing. Aroma of honey, barrels and vanilla. Flavors of honey, berries and woody 
Nice
Bottle - Raspberry name and vanilla. Deep purple red. Big raspberry up front, with some acidity and and long jammy finish. Honey is a bit in the back here, but decadent and nice.
Bottle. Pours a dark ruby purple with no head. The aroma is strong port, berries, vanilla. Thick mouth, jammy, berry, port, light oak, very impressive.
Bottle at RBWG 2016. Thanks to Dak. Now is very earthy and light vanilla. Seemingly a tad tart. Taste is like a dried fruit mix and a light alcohol warming. Nice.

375 ml bottle to taster (Dak, youre KILLING it with this Superstition lineup!). Looks good; a still, translucent black cherry. Smells outstanding! A nice balance of honey and raspberry alongside some black cherry and a nice presence from the port barrel. Tastes like it smells with a pleasantly tart full-bodied mouthfeel. Next-level stuff.

Bottle @ rbwg thanks to dak. Deep red velvet appearance with no head. Tannic raspberries, chocolate, cherries in the nose. Really nice mouth feel. Quite sweet but not overpowering. Tons of caramel and chocolate and raspberries. Quite good.

Bottle shared. Bright red pour. Aroma is super fruity, rich, complex jammy fruit notes, lots of vanilla. Taste is super fruity, light woodiness. Good palate, rich and warming, just a bit boozy. Very nice.
Amazing mead that is full of raspberry jam notes in aroma and flavor, the port barrel treatment comes through to make it a much more complex mead
The raspberry aroma and flavor is unparalleled in anything I've ever experienced. Incredible drink, smooth, rich, craft at it's best.
so perfect. i love the tart tart ciders...and now there is a mead. tart sweet balanced red. oh superstition, you do it right.
Wow. Bright tart raspberry on the nose and tongue. Underlying hints of port. Subtle honey sweetness. Words cant describe ... brilliance.
Deep purple pour. Loads of fresh raspberry, port wine, oak. A really welcomed tartness is present in this one. Great mead

This is Framboesa Atando without the Belgian candy sugar. Smells similar with deep raspberry, although not quite as deep. Taste is deep jammy raspberry, port, and grape juice. Body is full (a bit lighter than Framboesa) and sticky.
Deep red burgundy color. The tawny port comes through from the first taste. Nicely balanced. Nice raspberry undertones.
